description.en: Bismuth, a digital distributed self-regulating database system whose primary application is currency, and its first application is mining. It comes with a set of DAPPs out-of-the-box. Bismuth is not based on the code of BTC or any of its derivates, it is only inspired by some ideas laid down by Satoshi Nakamoto (BitCoin), Sunny King (Peercoin), NXT and ETH developers. Bismuth does not draw any code from other repositories, instead, it reformulates the cryptocurrency code in its own terms to be easily readable, compatible across all platforms, integrated into business solutions with utmost ease and most importantly open for development to a wide public through its simplicity while minimizing the security risk for custom code implementations. Bismuth is a decentralized transaction platform focused on modularity and open source approach. It comes with default decentralized applications and tools out of the box, not only to be used by everyone but also to be hosted by anyone. These applications are supplied as interpretation engines, which prevents blockchain bloat. Inspired by Satoshi’s whitepaper, Bismuth also offers optional hyperblocks as a pruning mechanism, a system which greatly reduces disk space usage and increases execution speed.

description.bg: Bismuth, a digital distributed self-regulating database system whose primary application is currency, and its first application is mining. It comes with a set of DAPPs out-of-the-box. Bismuth is not based on the code of BTC or any of its derivates, it is only inspired by some ideas laid down by Satoshi Nakamoto (BitCoin), Sunny King (Peercoin), NXT and ETH developers. Bismuth does not draw any code from other repositories, instead, it reformulates the cryptocurrency code in its own terms to be easily readable, compatible across all platforms, integrated into business solutions with utmost ease and most importantly open for development to a wide public through its simplicity while minimizing the security risk for custom code implementations. Bismuth is a decentralized transaction platform focused on modularity and open source approach. It comes with default decentralized applications and tools out of the box, not only to be used by everyone but also to be hosted by anyone. These applications are supplied as interpretation engines, which prevents blockchain bloat. Inspired by Satoshi’s whitepaper, Bismuth also offers optional hyperblocks as a pruning mechanism, a system which greatly reduces disk space usage and increases execution speed.

status_updates.description:
Bismuth monthly progress report is out:

https://hypernodes.bismuth.live/?p=2160

Test suite, tokens explorer and more...

Latest Bismuth progress report (June 15) is out:

Read more here: https://hypernodes.bismuth.live/?p=2142

Bismuth Toolbox - An awesome Android app from our contributor Whatever

What is Bismuth Toolbox?
A simple and low power app that allows you to monitor your $BIS wallets, $BIS mining, as well as notify you when your #Bismuth Hypernodes are down or lagging!

Free & open source: https://github.com/DoNutsLise/BismuthToolbox

Also available on Google Play store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.donuts.bismuth.bismuthtoolbox

A new game-changing use case for Bismuth just has been published: Decentralized electric vehicle battery monitoring.

Based upon state-of-the-art research on battery life and backed up by an extension of the Bismuth Tornado Wallet.

Read the full article at our blog:  https://hypernodes.bismuth.live/?p=1318

Latest Bismuth progress report is out.

Tornado wallet beefs up, new documented use cases, and seeing our tech spread to other coins.

Read more on our blog: https://hypernodes.bismuth.live/?p=1798

We just released a new post on the #Bismuth Blog.

See how the Bismuth platform - with its smart second layer protocols - allows for real world use cases like Decentralized Condition Monitoring.
More to come!

https://hypernodes.bismuth.live/?p=1527

Newest Bismuth monthly progress report is out.

Please check it out on our blog: https://hypernodes.bismuth.live/?p=1473

Bismuth Foundation
